title: National Seminar on Vedāṅgas and Upavedas
description: THE SAMSKRITA ACADEMY MADRAS & THE KUPPUSWAMI SASTRI RESEARCH INSTITUTE jointly organized a two-day NATIONAL SEMINAR ON UPAVEDAS & VEDANGAS on 22nd & 23rd NOVEMBER, 2024.
content:
Friday, 22nd November 2024 

INAUGURATION - 10.00 a.m. - 10.30 a.m. 

SRI KOMBUR RAMABHADRAN ENDOWMENT 


Dr. A. VASUDEVACHARIAR

(Founder & Principal, Sri Malola Samskrta Vidyapeetam, 

Veda Vedanta Gurukulam, Kancheepuram ) 


received the 


KOMBUR RAMABHADRAN CASH AWARD 


Dr. R.K. RAGHAVAN

(President, The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute, Chennai) 

presided over the Session 1.

event_name: National Seminar on Vedāṅgas and Upavedas

title: NARASIMHACHARI ENDOWMENT 2024 - SANSKRIT RECITATION COMPETITION
description: Under the Narasimhachari endownment, The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute conducted a Sanskrit Sloka recitation Competition  on 25th October 2024. Around 40 students from various city schools actively participated  in the competition and recited 20 shlokas from either SUBRAMHANYA BHUJANGAM or  SAUNDARYA LAHARI.
event_venue: Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Madapam, The KSRI

title: KSRI Faculty members invited as resource persons at TRAYI - A three-day event conducted by The Madras Sanskrit College
description:
On day 1 Session I of Palm-leaf reading, Dr. T.V. Vasudeva, Dy. Director, The KSRI  delivered a lecture on "Introduction of Manuscript & Script Knowledge" followed by a theory and practical presentation on "Handling & Preserving the manuscripts" by Smt. J. Lalitha, Librarian, KSRI, in Session III.

Dr. K.S. Balasubramanian, Director, KSRI was invited as the Chief Guest for the Valedictory function of Day 1 of TRAYI and delivered the valedictory address.

Enlightening the traditional Vedic students about Cataloguing in libraries, on Day 3, Session I of TRAYI, Smt. J. Lalitha spoke about "Ancient Subject Classification System & Cataloguing Card Entries"

title: 75th ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATIONS -  VALEDICTORY FUNCTION
description:
The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute is celebrating its 75th anniversary. To commemorate this milestone the Institute organized various National Workshops, Seminars and Lectures on various subjects like Bhakti, Art& Architecture, Sanskrit Literature, Ancient Indian Mathematics and Astronomy. 
The Valedictory Function of the 75th Anniversary Celebrations will be celebrated on 13th Sepetember, 2024 at 5.00pm at The Madras Sanskrit College Premises.

Dr. N. Gopalaswami IAS(Retd.) will preside over the function and release the book "ŚEṢASAMHITĀ" and honor the prominent donors.

Dr. S. Ramaratnam , Chancellor, Jagadguru Kripalu University, Odisha will deliver the Valedictory address.
event_venue: Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Madapam, The KSRI

title: Dr. V. Kameswari (former Director of the Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute) honored by the Governor of Tamil Nadu
description:
Dr. V.Kameswari (Former Director of the Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute) was honored with an award by the governor for her distinguished service to the field of Sanskrit and Indological research.
The Samskruta Bharati, Tamil Nadu organized a Samskruta Day celebration on August 19 2024 at the Bharatiyar Mandapam at Raj Bhavan, Guindy. Thiru. R.N. Ravi, Governor of Tamil Nadu was the Chief Guest and awarded various Sanskrit scholars and experts for their distinguished services to the field of Sanskrit.
event_name: SANSKRIT DAY CELEBRATIONS at RAJ BHAVAN
event_venue: Bharatiyar Mandapam at Raj Bhavan, Guindy

title: Dr. T.V. Vasudeva delivered a lecture on Introduction to Rigveda
description: Dr.T.V. Vasudeva (Deputy Director, The KSRI) co-ordinated Sastra prakashika trust endowment programme on " Studies on Rig Veda - Pancha Bhutas (Five Basic Elements)" at The Madras Sanskrit College, Mylapore.  In the first session of the programme, He also gave a talk on "Introduction to Rigveda".
event_name: Studies on Rig Veda - Pancha Bhutas (Five Basic Elements)"

title: PĀDUKĀ SAHASRAM OF SRI VEDANTA DESIKA - "VEDANTA DESIKA DAY"
description: Dr. P.C. Muralidharan (Asst. Prof., The KSRI)
event_name: Dr. Lakshmi Kumari and Varun Krishna Endowment
event_venue: Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Madapam, The KSRI

title: Sredhi Vyavahara -Progressions in Ancient Indian Mathematics
description: Ph.D. candidate Ms. B. Vijayalakshmi, under the supervision of Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Deputy Director, The KSRI,   submitted her synopsis on "Sredhi Vyavahara -Progressions in Ancient Indian Mathematics" at the Institute premises on 20th August 2024.
content:
SYNOPSIS PRESENTATION


Departmental Seminar in the case of Ms. B. Vijayalakshmi in connection with her Ph D thesis on Sredhi Vyavahara -Progressions in Ancient Indian Mathematics submitted before the Research Advisory Committee on 20th August 2024, Tuesday at 11.00 a.m. at The Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Mandapam, the KSRI. Request all the research scholars to attend the presentation.
event_venue: Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Madapam, The KSRI

title: National Workshop on  Ancient Indian Mathematics and Astronomy  – 26 & 27 of July 2024
description: The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute is celebrating its 75th anniversary.  To commemorate this milestone the institute organized a Two day  Workshop Ancient Indian Mathematics and Astronomy  on 26th & 27th of July 2024

title: A CRITICAL STUDY OF VAIRĀGYA AND MUMUKṢU-VYAVAHĀRA PRAKARAṆA OF THE YOGAVĀSIṢṬHA IN THE LIGHT OF THE COMMENTARY TĀTPARYAPRAKĀŚA OF  ŚRĪ ĀNANDABODHENDRA SARASVATĪ
description: Ph.D. candidate Ms. Lavanya V.Eswar, under the supervision of Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Deputy Director, The KSRI,   submitted her synopsis on "A CRITICAL STUDY OF VAIRĀGYA AND MUMUKṢU-VYAVAHĀRA PRAKARAṆA OF THE YOGAVĀSIṢṬHA IN THE LIGHT OF THE COMMENTARY TĀTPARYAPRAKĀŚA OF  ŚRĪ ĀNANDABODHENDRA SARASVATĪ" at the Institute premises on 19th July 2024.
content:
SYNOPSIS PRESENTATION


Departmental Seminar in the case of Ms. Lavanya V Eswar in connection with her thesis on A Critical Study of Vairāgya and Mumukṣu Prakaraṇa of the Yogavāsiṣṭha in the light of the Commentary Tātparyaprakāśa of Śrī Ānandabodhendra Sarasvatī, submitted before the Research Advisory Committee on 19th July 2024, Friday at 11.00 a.m. at The Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Mandapam, the KSRI. Request all the research scholars to attend the presentation.
event_venue: Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Madapam, The KSRI

title: National Workshop on Sanskrit Literature  – 28 & 29 of June 2024
description: We are happy to inform you all that the Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute is celebrating its 75th anniversary.  To commemorate this milestone the institute will be organising a Two day National Workshop on Sanskrit Literature on 28th and 29th of June 2024.
content:
We are happy to inform you all that the Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute is celebrating its 75th anniversary. To commemorate this milestone, the institute has proposed many activities such as the publication of books, and holding seminars!slash!conferences!slash!workshops throughout 2023-24 .  


      The Institute has already conducted national seminars on Arts and Architecture in Aug. 2023 and Bhakti Literature in Sanskrit and Tamil in November 2023.  


      Now a Two Day National Workshop on Sanskrit Literature is being held on the 28th and 29th of June 2024.


Please register using the google form link given below:

https:!slash!!slash!docs.google.com!slash!forms!slash!d!slash!1-2gnDWYOSzM0GxBIbQEprch63LJLFW_WSQoV6gIpntE!slash!edit


Please note: Register before 25th June 2024

  1. There is no registration fee. 
  2. TA!slash!DA and accommodation will not be provided.
  3. Participation certificate will be provided for all the participants. 
  4. Tea, Snacks and Lunch will be provided for all the participants.
event_venue: Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Madapam, The KSRI

title: National Workshop on Sanskrit Literature  – 28 & 29 of June 2024
description: The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute is celebrating its 75th anniversary.  To commemorate this milestone the institute organized a Two day National Workshop on Sanskrit Literature on 28th and 29th of June 2024.
content:
DAY 1 - 28th June 2024


Inauguration & release of Journal of Oriental Research


Dr. R.K. Raghavan (President, The KSRI) delivered the inaugural address and released the Journal of Oriental Research - Vol 94-95


Session 1 - 10.30-11.45am

Vedic Literature by Brahmasri Ankarai Rangaswamy Dikshitar under Sri. K.A. Lakshmana Sastri Endowment


Session 2 - 12.00 -1.15pm

Classical Literature by Dr. Thiagarajan under Dr. S.S. Janaki Commemoration Endownment


Session 3 - 2.30-3.45pm

Alankara Literature by Dr. C.S. Radhakrishanan under Dr. M. Narasimhachari Memorial Endownment


DAY 2 - 29th June 2024


Session 4 - 10.30-11.45am

Modern Literature by Dr. T.V. Vasudeva under Subadra Memorial Endowment.


Session 5 - 12.00-1.45pm

Technical Literature by Dr. V. Kameswari under Sundaram Saraswathi Endownment.


Session 6 - 2.30-3.45pm

Darsanas by Dr. K. Srinivasan under Sri. R. Narasimhachari Endowment.
event_venue: Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Madapam, The KSRI

title: SŪRYA IN SANSKRIT LITERATURE VIS-A-VIS MODERN CONCEPTS
description: Ph.D. candidate Mrs. S. RENGANAYAKI, under the supervision of Dr. V. Kameswari, Former Director of The KSRI, defended her thesis on "SŪRYA IN SANSKRIT LITERATURE VIS-A-VIS MODERN CONCEPTS" at the Institute premises on May 22, 2024.
event_name: SŪRYA IN SANSKRIT LITERATURE VIS-A-VIS MODERN CONCEPTS

title: RATNASAṄGRAHAḤ OF ŚRĪ RAGHUNĀTHĀCĀRYA: CRITICAL EDITION AND STUDY
description: Ph. D. candidate Mr. S Balakrishnan, under the supervision of Dr. T.V. VASUDEVA, (M.A., Ph.D.), Deputy Director, The KSRI,   defended his thesis on "RATNASAṄGRAHAḤ OF ŚRĪ RAGHUNĀTHĀCĀRYA: CRITICAL EDITION AND STUDY" at the Institute premises on 7th May 2024.

title: National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil – DAY 2
description: As a Part of the 75th Anniversary, The KSRI conducted a National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil" on 24th and 25th of November 2023 in collaboration with The Samskrita Academy, Madras.
content:
25.11.2023 - Session IV – Other Deities – 10:00 am to 11:30 am

Session IV - Other Deities -  K.A. Lakshmana Sastri Endowment, Smt. Balambal Memorial Endowment and T.V. Nagaraja Iyer Endowment, Dr. T.N. Aravamudan, Former Principal, Rajah's College, Thiruvaiyaru Chaired the session. 


The following scholars presented their Papers:

 

1.     Dr.V. Sowmyanarayanan – Navagrahas

(Head & Asst. Prof., of Sanskrit, D.G.Vaishnav College, Chennai)

2.     Dr. Sarika Sasi – Bhakti as a self- sustained discipline - Nārāyaṇīyam

(Asst. Prof. Sanskrit College, Tripunithura)

3.     Dr. R. Santanakrishnan – திருப்பாவை - வீடுபேற்றின் திறவுகோல் ஆய்வுச்சுருக்கம்

(Asst.Prof.,Tamil Dept., St.Thomas Arts and Science College, Koyambedu)

4.     Ms. Kshama

(SSS Shasun Jain College For Women)

5.      Mr. A. Padmanabhan

(Research Scholar, The Madras Sanskrit College)

6.     Ms. K. Sreya – Portrayal of Vaishnavism in Vatsarāja's Plays

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

7.     Ms. A.P. Soorya – Bhakti reflected in Puṇdarīkapureśastava of Ramaswami Sastri

(Research Scholar, Dept. of Sanskrit, SSUS, Kalady)

8.     Mr. K. N. Bharath – Bhagavānukkum bhaktanukkumul̥l̥a navavidha sambandaṅgal̥

(Research Scholar, Shri Ahobila Math Sanskrit Adarsh Vidyalaya)


25.11.2023 - Session V – Gānapatyam, Kaumāram etc.  – 11:30 am to 01:00 pm

Session V - Gānapatyam, Kaumāram etc. -  Dr. S. Jayasree Memorial Endowment,  

Sri T.M. Krishnaswamy Iyer and other Endowments Prof. L. Kumaraswamy, Former Prof. & Head Dept. of Sanskrit, D.G. Vaishnav College, Chennai Chaired the session. 


The following scholars presented their Papers:


1.      Dr.V. Mohan – Works of Arunagirinathar

(Asst.Director, CPR Institute of Indological Research, Chennai)

2.      Ms. M.M. Ekalakshmi – Tamil Bhakti movement and Social Reformation

(Asst. Prof., Shasun Jain College)

3.      Dr. Sharda Narayanan – Māṇikyavācakakr̥tam Tiruvācakam

(Asst. Prof, Dr MGR-Janaki College for Women)

4.      Ms. Sowmiya R – Depiction of Bhakti in Nr̥gamokṣa Prabandha of Nārāyaṇa Bhaṭṭa

(Asst. Prof., M.O.P. Vaishnav College for Women, Chennai) 

5.      Ms. Rajee R – Bhakti in Śrỉ Subrahmaṇya Bhujaṅgam

(Research Student, Presidency College, Chennai)

6.      Mr. C. Srimayur – Śrīgaṇeśeparābhaktiḥ

(Research Scholar, RKMV College, Chennai)

7.      Risal Muhammed M    –    Śaivism Through Advaidic Values: Srī Nārāyana Guru's Tevārappathikaṅgal̥  

(Post Graduate Student, SSUS, Kalady)

8.      Ms. M. Geethalakshmi – Tamil̥ bhakti Ilakkiyattil Paṭṭiṇattārin Bhakti

(Research Scholar)      

9.      Ms. Amrutha K.B. –  Characteristics of Devotion and Rarity of Meter: 

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)   Aśvadhāṭīkāvya of Jagannātha


25.11.2023 - Session VI – Darśanas – 2:00 pm to 3:30 pm

Session VI - Darśanas -  Prof. R. Sankari Endowment & Mm. Prof. S. Kuppuswami Sastri and other Endowments Dr. Radha Ragunathan, Director, The Adyar Library Research Centre, Chennai Chaired the session. 


The following scholars presented their Papers:


1.     Dr. M. Archana                                          Execution of Bhakti in Nārada Bhakti Sūtras

Asst. Prof., Dept. of Sanskrit, Seethalakshmi Achi College for women, Karaikudi

2.    Dr. S. Madhurambika                                 Nāma-bhakti in the Kaveri Belt

Asst. Prof, (SS), Dept. of Sanskrit, Ethiraj college, Chennai

3.     Ms. Athulya Raj                                             Exhortation of Bhakti Reflected in

 Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady                   Srī Nārāyana Guru's Darśanamālā

4.      Ms. Charumathy. B                                     The Place of Bhakti in Indian Philosophy

Project Staff, IIT – Madras

5.     Ms. Jayashree. R                                       Bhakti Ilakkiyam

Research scholar, University of Madras

6.     Ms. Y. Shanmuga Priya Dharshini          Bhakti Tradition in Indian Philosophy

Research Scholar, The Madras Sanskrit College

7.     Dr. V. Yamuna Devi                                             Deśabhakti

Associate Prof. The KSRI

8.      Dr.P.C.Muralidharan                                  Garuḍa Bhakti of Śrī Vedānta Deśika

 Asst.Prof., The KSRI

9.    Dr. V. Preethi                      The Concept of Bhakti in Bhopadeva's Muktāphala

Asst.Prof., The KSRI

10. Ms. Lavanya.V. Eswar                   Subrahmaṇya Bhārati and Kṛṣṇa Bhakti

Research Scholar, The KSRI


Valediction on 25.11.2023

The valedictory function of the two-day National Seminar on Bhakti Literature in Sanskrit and Tamil was held on 25.11.2023 at 3.30 pm.  Dr C.L. Ramakrishnan, Former Director, Dept. of Vigilance and Anti-corruption, delivered the Valedictory address under Justice N Rajagopala Ayyangar Endowment.
event_name: National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil - DAY 2

title: National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil – DAY 1
description: As a Part of the 75th Anniversary, The KSRI conducted a National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil" on 24th and 25th of November 2023 in collaboration with The Samskrita Academy, Madras.
content:
24.11.2023 - Inauguration - 10.00am-11.00am


Dr. R. K. Raghavan, President of the KSRI delivered the Welcome address. Prof. C. R. Anantharaman, Former Prof. of Sanskrit, Vivekananda College, Tiruvedagam, Madurai received the Kombur Ramabhadran Cash Award and delivered the inaugural address on 24th November 2023 .  


 24.11.2023 - Session I – Vaiṣṇava – 11:00 am to 1:00 pm 

Session I - Vaiṣṇava under Sri Narasimhachari Endowment and . Dr. Lakshmi Kumari and Varun Krishna Endowment, Dr. S. Muthu, Prof. of Sanskrit, RKM Vivekananda College, Chennai Chaired the session. 


The following scholars have presented their Papers:


1. Dr. Sridhar Swaminathan – Pañcavarṇastava of Aghoraśivācārya

(Head & Asst. Prof., of Sanskrit, Vivekananda College, Madurai)

2. Dr. N. Bhuvaneswari – Bhakti in Śivānandalaharī

(Research Scholar, The KSRI, Chennai)

3. Ms. R. Rajalakshmi – Śivotkarṣamañjarī –Viṣayavivecanam

(Research student, The Madras Sanskrit College, Chennai)

4. Dr. M. Uma Maheswari – Bhagavān Ramaṇa Maharṣi's Arunācalastuti Pañcakam

(Head & Asst. Prof. Queen Mary's College, Chennai)

 5. Dr. S. Sivaguhan – Śivapūjāstave Śivasya stotrarūpā-pujā-Bhaktiḥ

(Asst. Librarian, GOML, Chennai )

 6. Ms. P. H. Athira – Śaivasiddhāntaparamparāyāḥ ādhyātmikatarkāḥ

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

7. Ms. J. Madhangi – Bhaktirasāyaṇadr̥ṣṭyā Śivabhaktisamīkṣṇam

(M.A. Sanskrit, Sastra Deemed University, Tanjavur)

8. Mr. K. Vijayakumar – Kerala Tāntric Texts: Śaiva - Vaiṣṇava Syncretism    

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

9. Ms. Praveena Suresh – Śaivadarśaneṣu Pāśupataśaivadarśanam tasya vaiśiṣṭyam ca

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

10.Ms. C.K. Saranya –        Śrī nārāyaṇaguroḥ cidambarāṣṭakastotrakāvye śaivadarśanasya prabhāvaḥ

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady) –


24.11.2023 - Session II – Śaiva – 2:00 pm to 3:30 pm 

Session II - Śaiva under Sri Ramakrishna Iyer Memorial Endowment and Sri Anna Subrahmania Iyer Centenary Endowment, Dr. G. Suresh, Asst. Prof. of Sāhitya, The Madras Sanskrit College, Chaired the session. 


The following scholars presented their Papers:


1. Dr. Sridhar Swaminathan – Pañcavarṇastava of Aghoraśivācārya

(Head & Asst. Prof., of Sanskrit, Vivekananda College, Madurai)

2. Dr. N. Bhuvaneswari – Bhakti in Śivānandalaharī

(Research Scholar, The KSRI, Chennai)

3. Ms. R. Rajalakshmi – Śivotkarṣamañjarī –Viṣayavivecanam

(Research student, The Madras Sanskrit College, Chennai)

4. Dr. M. Uma Maheswari – Bhagavān Ramaṇa Maharṣi's Arunācalastuti Pañcakam

(Head & Asst. Prof. Queen Mary's College, Chennai)

 5. Dr. S. Sivaguhan – Śivapūjāstave Śivasya stotrarūpā-pujā-Bhaktiḥ

(Asst. Librarian, GOML, Chennai )

 6. Ms. P. H. Athira – Śaivasiddhāntaparamparāyāḥ ādhyātmikatarkāḥ

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

7. Ms. J. Madhangi – Bhaktirasāyaṇadr̥ṣṭyā Śivabhaktisamīkṣṇam

(M.A. Sanskrit, Sastra Deemed University, Tanjavur)

8. Mr. K. Vijayakumar – Kerala Tāntric Texts: Śaiva - Vaiṣṇava Syncretism    

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

9. Ms. Praveena Suresh – Śaivadarśaneṣu Pāśupataśaivadarśanam tasya vaiśiṣṭyam ca

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

10.  Ms. C.K. Saranya – Śrī nārāyaṇaguroḥ cidambarāṣṭakastotrakāvye śaivadarśanasya prabhāvaḥ

(Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)


 24.11.2023 - Session III – Śākta and others – 3:30 pm to 5:00 pm

Session III - Śākta and others Subhadra Memorial Endowment and Bhagirati Ammal Endowment, Dr. T.V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of the KSRI Chaired the session. 


The following scholars presented their Papers:

 

1.  Ms. Ananda A. – Bhakti in Śrīpāda Saptati of Melpputhur Nārāyaṇa Bhaṭṭa

    (Research scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

2. Mr. L. Sriram – Glimpse of bhakti from Kaṭākṣaśatakam of Mūkapañcaśatī

    (Research Scholar, The KSRI, Chennai)

3. Ms. Chandra Shankar – Thamizhil Bhakti Ilakkiyam

(Research Scholar, University of Madras, Chennai)

 4. Mr. T.R. Sarath – The Harmony of Śiva and Śakti: Tantra Literature

 (Research Scholar, SSUS, Kalady)

 5. Ms. Raghavi – Rāmakathāmrutasāra of Srī Kr̥śṇapremi Svāmigal

 (Research Scholar, Loyola College, Chennai)   

 6. Mr. T. Maria Dhanaraj

 (Research Scholar, Madurai Kamaraj University, Madurai)

7. Mr. Abhinav Kadambi – Vedāntadeśika's Sudarśanāṣṭakastotra and Şoḍaśāyudhastotra

 (Research Scholar, Presidency College, Chennai )

8. Mr. D. Jagadeesan – Śaivāgamoddhr̥tabhakti

   (Research scholar, Sastra Deemed University, Tanjavur)
event_name: National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil - DAY 1

title: National Seminar on Arts and Architecture - DAY II
description: As a Part of the 75th Anniversary, The KSRI conducted a two day "National Seminar on Arts and Architecture" on 21st and 22nd of August 2023 in collaboration with The Samskrita Academy, Madras.
content:
22.08.2023 - Session III – Arts – 10.30 pm to 1.30 pm 


Session III - Arts under Sundaram Saraswati, N.V. Raghavan and P.K. Subramania Iyer Endowments. Dr. V. Kameswari, Former Director, The KSRI, Chennai  Chaired the session.


The following scholars presented their Papers:

1. Dr. R. Thyagarajan – Ratna Śāstra (Gemology)

2. Dr. S. Venugopal – Sāmudrikā Lakṣaṇam

3. Dr. V. Yamuna Devi – Dhātukalā - Metallurgy and Alloy making 

4. Dr. P.C. Muralidharan – Sowing of seeds as gleaned from Kr̥ṣi Parāśara 

5. Dr. S. Murali – Śakuna Śāstra (Omens)


National Seminar on Arts and Architecture – Valediction on 22.8.2023


Valedictory function of the two day National Seminar on Arts and Architecture was held on 22nd August 2023 at 3.00 pm.  Dr. C. S. Radhakrishnan, former Professor of Sanskrit, Central University, Puducherry delivered the Valedictory address under Prof. V. Venkatachalam Endowment.  


﻿To enjoy the Seminar sessions click the youtube link given below:-

event_name: National Seminar on Arts and Architecture - DAY II

title: National Seminar on Arts and Architecture - DAY I
description: As a Part of the 75th Anniversary, The KSRI conducted a two day "National Seminar on Arts and Architecture" on 21st and 22nd of August 2023 in collaboration with The Samskrita Academy, Madras.  Dr. R. K. Raghavan, President of the KSRI delivered the Welcome address. Śilpakalāratnam Dr. T. Satyamurthy, Former Superintending Archaeologist, ASI, Chennai, delivered the inaugural address on 21st Augutst 2023 .
content:
21.08.2023 - Session I – Architecture – 11.30 am to 1.30 pm 

Session I - Architecture under Dr. S. S. Janaki & P. Venkatesa Deksitar Endowments. Dr. Arunasundaram, Principal i!slash!c, The Madras Sanskrit College, Chennai Chaired the session.


The following scholars presented their Papers:

1. Sri. Madhusudanan Kalaiselvan – Development of Column Orders Pallava and Chola

2. Dr. Ramadevi Sekhar – Cosmic plan in Micro-scale Hindu Temple

3. Dr. Vasumati Rajaram – Some Aspects of Town Planning in Ancient India

4. Dr. K. Vidyuta – Architecture and the Mind 


21.08.2023 - Session II – Arts – 2.30 pm to 4.30 pm 

Session II - Arts under Dr. M. Narasimhachari Memorial Endowment, Sri. Venkatanarayana Iyer and Smt. Sundarambal Endowments. Dr. R. Thyagarajan Former Prof. & Head, Dept. of Sanskrit, Presidency College, Chennai Chaired the session.


The following scholars presented their Papers:

1. Dr. Padmaja Suresh – Bharatanāṭyam as a ritual

2. Dr. T.V. Vasudeva – Mallavidyā (Wrestling)

3. Dr. Abhiramasundari – Musicology and Practicing Music

4. Dr. S. Umapathi – Prahelikā (Puzzles and Brain Teasers)



To enjoy the Seminar sessions click the youtube link given below:-


https:!slash!!slash!youtube.com!slash!playlist?list=PLxMP5bsz77o3ZTIBQxbNkUgmkULBDuzFB&si=HgbOLEogWwqVxxrL

description: Seminars during Birth Centenary Celebrations of Prof.S.KuppuswamiSastri - on diverse subjects...
content:
Seminars during Birth Centenary Celebrations of Prof.S.KuppuswamiSastri - on diverse subjects

Art, Archeaology, Ayurveda, Literature, Yoga &Sastras, Vedic Recitation with special emphasis on its nuances like Pada, Ghana, Jata etc. and KaviSammelanam (Poet's meet).
